content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

Here's a function that you can use to extract questions and answers from markdown text formatted with `# Question` and `# Answer`:

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::String)
    questions = Array{String}()
    answers = Array{String}()
    question_open = false
    answer_open = false

    for line in split(md, "\n")
        if occursin("# Question", line)
            question_open = true
            continue
        end
        if occursin("# Answer", line)
            answer_open = true
            continue
        end
        if question_open && answer_open
            if !isempty(line)
                answers += [strip(line)]
            else
                question_open = false
                answer_open = false
            end
            continue
        end
        if answer_open
            answers += [strip(line)]
            continue
        end
        if question_open
            questions += [strip(line)]
        end
    end
    return (join(questions, "\n"), join(answers, "\n"))
end
```

This function uses a stateful approach to keep track of whether it's in the `Question` or `Answer` section. When a new section starts, it resets the state and continues processing the lines. The stripped text for each section is then joined back together with newlines.

Please note that this function assumes that there are no nested sections (i.e., one `# Question` followed by one `# Answer` without any other headers in between). If your markdown contains more complex structures, you might need to modify the function accordingly.
